task.title: Creating a New Image from an Existing Image
task.shortdesc: A common way to create a new image is to customize an existing image.

context.p: This example shows how to create a new EBS-backed Eucalyptus image based on an existing EBS-backed Eucalyptus instance.

step.cmd: Log on to an existing Eucalyptus EBS-backed instance and customize the instance.

Create a new image based on the image you just modified by using the eucalyptus-create-image command, specifying a name, a description, and the instance ID of the Eucalyptus instance you customized in the previous step. For example:

info.codeph: euca-create-image -name "mynewimage" -d "This is my new custom recycled image" -i i-1ABCDEFF
info.p: This command will show the ID of the new machine image and exit immediately. In the background, Eucalyptus will begin the process of creating a new image based on the instance you supplied.

info.p: When the image status is listed as "available" your new image will be ready for use.
